p: A total of 200 Japanese quails at 1-week-old with average body weight of 30.02 ± 0.10 g were haphazardly allotted to 5 groups of 40 chicks in 5 replicates (8 per replicate). The first group was the control (basal diet) group ( Table 1), while LGEO was added at levels of 150, 300, 450, and 600 mg/kg diet in the 2nd, 3rd, 4th and 5th groups, respectively. All birds were reared under the same managerial conditions in conventional cages (90 × 40 × 40 cm), with free access to the water and feed during the experimental period. The LGEO was purchased from Elhawag Company for Natural oils, Cairo, Egypt. This study was performed at quail unit, Waterfowl Farm, Department of Poultry, Faculty of Agriculture, Zagazig University, Egypt.The experimental procedures were performed according to the Local Experimental Animal Care Committee, Zagazig University.
